law thermodynamic: i'm not a physicist, but i think this has something to do with heat, entropy, and conservation of energy, right?
wavelength: wavelength is the inverse of frequency.
thermodynamic: the branch of physics dealing with the transformation of heat to and from other forms of energy, and with the laws governing such conversions of energy.
crystallography: this is the science dealing with the study of crystals.
avogadro s number: it is the number of molecules per mole.  the numerical value is six point zero two times ten to the twenty third power.
ultrasound: ultrasonic waves, used in medical diagnosis and therapy, in surgery, etc.
bioinformatic: a fancy name for applied computer science in biology.
ichthyology: we talk about this when we study fishes.
h2o: h is to o as o is to v.
cytology: well, from what i can recall it is the study of cells.
bacteriology: this is the scientific study of bacteria and diseases caused by them.
gravitation: the force by which every mass or particle of matter, including photons, attracts and is attracted by every other mass or particle of matter.
far sun: the sun is about 93 million miles from earth.
far moon: the moon is about 250,000 miles from earth on average.
tell venus: venus is the second planet from the sun.
